definitions.definition: (of a thing) of a suitable quality, standard, or type to meet the required purpose.
examples: the meat is fit for human consumption

definitions.definition: (of a person) having the requisite qualities or skills to undertake something competently.
examples: he felt himself quite fit for battle
synonyms: equipped "is he fit to look after a child?"

definitions.definition: suitable and correct according to accepted social standards.
examples: a fit subject on which to correspond

definitions.definition: (of a person or thing) having reached such an extreme condition as to be on the point of doing the thing specified.
examples: he baited even his close companions until they were fit to kill him
synonyms: about; informalpsyched up "you look fit to commit murder!"

definitions.definition: ready.
in good health, especially because of regular physical exercise.
examples: I swim regularly to keep fit
synonyms: as fit as a fiddle; Moreathletic
in the pink "he looked tanned and fit"

definitions.definition: sexually attractive; good-looking.
be of the right shape and size for.
try clothing on (someone) in order to make or alter it to the correct size.
examples: she was about to be fitted for her costume

definitions.definition: be of the right size, shape, or number to occupy a particular position or place.
examples: Angela says we can all fit in her car

definitions.definition: fix or put (something) into place.
examples: they fitted smoke alarms to their home

definitions.definition: provide (something) with a particular component or article.
examples: most tools can be fitted with a new handle
synonyms: furnish "cameras fitted with a backlight button"

definitions.definition: join or cause to join together to form a whole.
examples: it took a while to figure out how the confounded things fit together
synonyms: slot together "concrete slabs were fitted together"

definitions.definition: be in agreement or harmony with; match.
examples: the punishment should fit the crime
synonyms: be consonant with "a sentence that fits her crimes"

definitions.definition: (of an attribute, qualification, or skill) make (someone) suitable to fulfill a particular role or undertake a particular task.
examples: an MS fits the student for a professional career
synonyms: groom "an MA fits you for a professional career"

definitions.definition: the particular way in which something, especially a garment or component, fits around or into something.
examples: the dress was a perfect fit

definitions.definition: the particular way in which a thing matches something else.
examples: a close fit between teachers' qualifications and their teaching responsibilities
synonyms: concurrence "the degree of fit between a school's philosophy and practice"

definitions.definition: the correspondence between observed data and the values expected by theory.
a sudden uncontrollable outbreak of intense emotion, laughter, coughing, or other action or activity.
synonyms: conniption (fit) "my mother would have a fit if she knew"

definitions.definition: a sudden attack of convulsions and/or loss of consciousness, typical of epilepsy and some other medical conditions.
examples: he thought she was having a fit

definitions.definition: a section of a poem.
